result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis Lashawn Curry Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Curtis Lashawn Curry Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Curtis Lashawn Curry Jr. was found guilty of Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid during the term of probation.
$150.00 bond to be applied to costs.
Defendant shall cooperate with, participate in, and successfully complete evaluations, treatment and counseling deemed appropriate by Agent.

timeConds.notes: May be served in Dane County. May be served under the Huber Law as long as the defendant reports and remains alcohol and controlled substance free.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: PLQ and Elements

3:30PM Defendant Curtis Lashawn Curry Jr. in court.  Attorney Jane Krueger Smith in court for Curtis Lashawn Curry Jr.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated. Factual basis found. Plea Questionnaire filed and reviewed. The defendant enters a plea to count 2 of no contest. The Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 and orders a JOC be entered. The Court dismisses count 1 w prejudice. The Court orders on count 2 a withheld sentence to serve probation for a period of 3 years, with the conditions of a 6 month jail term to be served with Huber (This may be served in Dane County) and is to report on 12/04/2022 by 6:00PM, To pay restitution in the amount of $1,337.63 w the 10% interest totaling $1,471.39, to pay all costs of this action and The defendant shall cooperate with, participate in, and successfully complete evaluations, treatment and counseling deemed appropriate by Agent. The repeater modifier is to be dismissed. $150 in bond is to be applied to costs. The defendant has 97 days of sentence credit.

Curtis Lashawn Curry Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Jane Krueger Smith appeared by video for Curtis Lashawn Curry Jr.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing waiver filed with the court. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed.  Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. No substitution requested. Not Guilty plea entered on each count. Defendant is seeking a reduction for bond. Attorney Nolen has no objection to $1000 surety bond if Marcia Curry is willing to sign. The alternative is $150 cash.    Matter set over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
